topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5516fa6063687260ad080000#post_5516fa6063687260ad080000
Where are you even getting that? I want to lobby lawmakers for stricter laws to help and protect victims, encourage refusal to buy products or services that are contributing to the continued degradation of woman, you think i am with those buffoons like Down with molestia? 

And i am going to spell this out very clearly, I personally hold the view that in the long term preventing rape is a larger net gain then simply reacting to it, I in no way think we shouldn't, But if your asking would i prefer to cure the disease rather then treat the symptoms, then the answer is yes, Now like any sane person i feel we should do both, mitigate the pain until we can prevent it all together, To put it in the absolute simplest of terms, I do not believe that somehow helping a rape victim and changing the out look towards woman to help discourage the act are mutually exclusive goals,

And this is over, I'm not talking to you anymore not if it means upsetting Trashy,

"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5516fdc0636872652c7a0000#post_5516fdc0636872652c7a0000
That's not true, you can see how societies differ, some are far worse, and we can make it better! imagine the difference between how the USA reacts to a gang rape in public to how India reacts, but we can do more, we haven't reached the limits, we aren't done being better, Believe it or not, Some people can over come an urge if they know it's wrong, but we don't always make that clear, and yes there will always be rape, but you can't convince me that we can't do better, and if we stop trying then we fail at our only goal, sentient life exists to move forward to be better then it was,
